channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: There’s finally inflation from tariffs — in Hermes bags
item.description: Luxury-goods giant Hermes International has been passing along tariff increases to its U.S. customers.

item.title: Kraft Heinz takes $9 billion charge for its stock’s ‘sustained decline’ as it ponders strategic options

item.title: This one chart shows $7 trillion doesn’t go as far as many suggest
item.description: The ‘cash on the sideline’ story is not as compelling as it sounds.

item.title: ‘The sky has not fallen yet’: A recession has been predicted for years. Is it time to stop worrying?
item.description: GDP rose by 3% in the second quarter after falling 0.5% in the first quarter. Roll on the third quarter.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
